results.title: The Desert hopping mouse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Focuses on the spinifex hopping mouse of inland Australia to illustrate the many features it possesses which enable it to survive in what appears to be an extremely hostile environment. Also shows its daily activities, its methods of reproduction and the ways in which these may change with the seasons or from year to year. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Desert fox
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hills, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: July, 1942, war veterans recall the best fighting animal of the era, and a great mate - the desert fox (who looks remarkably like Rommel), captured in a visual array of claymation, stop frame and animation in this war mockumentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Hills, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: The Desert dreamers (A)
results.creator_credit: Geoff Dunlop and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A video about the paintings produced by the Papunya Aboriginal people, some 200 miles from Alice Springs. Looking like twentieth century abstracts, the paintings use an extremely complex symbolic language that relates to religious ceremonies. Some of them are outstandingly beautiful. All reveal the richness of desert Aboriginal life and culture. Shows the lives of the painters and their families, desert nomads who are being forced to come to terms with the realities of white technology, economics and values.

results.title: The Desert
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the desert biome; its geographical locations, the causes of its formation, its temperature conditions and consequent aridity; its dust storms, and its rains. Shows the diversity of the plants and animals of the desert and how they adapt to their arid environment.

results.title: The Descent
results.creator_credit: Andrew Schultz, John Bird, David Atkinson, Film Victoria and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A claymation (influenced by Jan Svankmejer in sepia tones and use of stop-still animated found objects and cut-tin figurines) depicts a storm ravaged landscape of an empire. The ruling giant, ‘metal’ Queen summons her miniature servants to find and rescue her giant clay King. Like ants the small servants work together to unite the King and Queen.

results.title: The Dermis probe
results.creator_credit: Institute of Comparative Dermatography and Richard Williams Films
results.brief_description: Philosophical, scientific voices intone the marvels beyond man’s comprehension, to the accompaniment of dreamy, highly coloured images and sounds. Until, finally the camera pulls back to reveal the subject of the symposium. This parody of the jargon and the relentless close-ups of didactic scientific films is actually a parable of an 800 year old story: “Elephant in the Dark” a little fable about people who feel different parts of an elephant, all believing that what they feel is the whole beast. A serious yet entertaining look at the impediments in current thought which prevent certain forms of understanding between people. Written by Idries Shah

results.title: The Depths of space: exterior galaxies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Universe”.
The 200-inch telescope of Palomar Observatory reveals, to the limit of its two billion light year range, a universe strewn with other milky ways or galaxies like our own, with misty objects faintly visible which indicate that there are other galaxies lying beyond even that vast distance.

results.title: The Department manager
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Nicholas Balla, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film is centered on a mini-drama in which a successful design engineer encounters many problems when he is promoted to a managerial position. The film raises questions about the sources of job satisfaction, the perils of promotion from within the organization, and the demands that are put on a person placed for the first time in an administrative or managerial role.

results.title: The Departed
results.creator_credit: Felix Chong, William Monahan, Alan Mak, Graham King, Brad Grey, Kristi Zea, Martin Scorsese, Brad Pitt, Sandy Powell, Plan B Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, Initial Entertainment Group (IEG), Media Asia Films and Vertigo Entertainment
results.brief_description: To take down South Boston’s Irish Mafia, the police send in one of their own to infiltrate the underworld, not realising the syndicate has done likewise.

constellations_other.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_other.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Felix Chong, William Monahan, Alan Mak, Graham King, Brad Grey, Kristi Zea, Martin Scorsese, Brad Pitt, Sandy Powell, Plan B Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, Initial Entertainment Group (IEG), Media Asia Films and Vertigo Entertainment
results.description: To take down South Boston’s Irish Mafia, the police send in one of their own to infiltrate the underworld, not realizing the syndicate has done likewise. While an undercover cop curries favor with the mob kingpin, a career criminal rises through the police ranks. But both sides soon discover there’s a mole among them.

results.title: The Dentist
results.brief_description: A Mack Sennett comedy, starring W.C. Fields as an irascible and unconventional dentist who performs entertaining antics on the golf course and in his dental offices.
